info.title: FHIR Practitioner resource API documentation
info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.

get.description:
Returns Practitioners based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for Practitioner.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: An address in any kind of address/part

parameters.name: address-city
parameters.description: A city specified in an address

parameters.name: address-country
parameters.description: A country specified in an address

parameters.name: address-postalcode
parameters.description: A postalCode specified in an address

parameters.name: address-state
parameters.description: A state specified in an address

parameters.name: address-use
parameters.description: A use code specified in an address

parameters.name: communication
parameters.description: One of the languages that the practitioner can communicate with

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: A value in an email contact

parameters.name: family
parameters.description: A portion of the family name

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: Gender of the practitioner

parameters.name: given
parameters.description: A portion of the given name

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: A practitioner's Identifier

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: One of the locations at which this practitioner provides care

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A portion of either family or given name

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The identity of the organization the practitioner represents / acts on behalf of

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: A value in a phone contact

parameters.name: phonetic
parameters.description: A portion of either family or given name using some kind of phonetic matching algorithm

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: The practitioner can perform this role at for the organization

parameters.name: specialty
parameters.description: The practitioner has this specialty at an organization

parameters.name: telecom
parameters.description: The value in any kind of contact

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing Practitioner based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.
